alert.note: Alert for Grayson; Smyth; Tazewell (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 11:16AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Smyth, southwestern Tazewell and western Grayson Counties through 1215 PM EDT... At 1116 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Chilhowie, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Marion... Saltville... Chilhowie... Mount Rogers National Recreation Area... Sugar Grove... Troutdale... and Hungry Mother State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
